Entries.fall_12{{YearRemainder}}: Ugh, I've got so much alfalfa I need to harvest for winter.
Entries.Mon8: Always nice to see happy cows running out of the barn in spring.#$b#Cows really do prefer fresh grass
Entries.summer_Mon8: Cows don't tolerate heat very well, they do better in places that get cold in winter.
Entries.fall_Mon8: Free-range chickens are so much happier.$h
Entries.winter_Mon8: It's important to keep the barn warm enough in winter!

Entries.8{{YearRemainder}}: I've got {{Range: 5,10}} cows to artificially inseminate tomorrow morning. It'll be a long day...
Entries.25{{YearRemainder}}: Ugh, we seem to have a digital dermatitis outbreak among my cows.#$b#I'll need to get a vet in, might need to get antibiotics administered.
Entries.26{{YearRemainder}}: Between you and I, I wish it was easier to socialize around these parts without going to the Saloon.#$b#It's not good for Shane.$s
Entries.27{{YearRemainder}}: Gonna have my nutritionist come out tomorrow, check to see how my livestock are doing.#$b#It's very important to feed your livestock the right food!

Entries.5_2: My dear Bessie stepped on a nail the other day. Poor darling, I need to do a better job making sure their pen doesn't have dangerous items in it.
Entries.6_2: Maybe I should get my cows another back scratching brush...
Entries.7_2: I try to keep my dairy organic. It's better for the cows, most of the time.
Entries.18_2: Most dairy farms don't keep bulls around. It's too dangerous, usually.#$b#Bulls can be quite unpredictable.
Entries.23_2: We're not allowed to use antibiotics, lest we lose our organic certification.
Entries.24_2: Gotta go shovel out the cows' pen. That'll probably take an entire day.#$b#Makes for good fertilizer, though!$h

Entries.summer_Mon10: I hope it rains more. The more it rains, the cheaper the feed for my animals is.
Entries.5_2: %Marnie looks exhausted.#$e#Oh, @, how have you been doing?#$b#I'm just a little tired, I'm not sure how much longer I can wake up every day at four in the morning to milk the cows.
Entries.6_2: The chickens love following the cows around as the cows graze. They eat the bugs the cow patties attract.$h#$b#Nature never wastes anything.$h
Entries.8_2: My Bessie gave birth to a fresh calf this morning.$h#$b#No matter how many times it happens, it's always special to me.$h
Entries.10_2: Been thinking of moving to milking three times a day. That'd be a lot more work, but it's more comfortable for the cows and they'll produce more milk.
Entries.11_2: It's important for farm animals to be fed a well-rounded diet!$h
Entries.24_2: When you have animals depending on you, it's much harder to take a day off.
Entries.26_2: Ugh, the price of barley has gone way up.$s

Entries.5_2: I've got to buy more barley to feed to the cows, but the price of barley has gone insane over the last year...$s#$b#Might need to figure out something else, for feeding them.
Entries.6_2: Bessie got some rocks lodged into her hoof the other day...Poor darling, that looked quite painful.$s
Entries.10_2: I have to make sure to feed the cows a well-rounded diet, or else they produce less milk.
Entries.11_2: Jas is an independent child, always has been.#$b#Kid in rural areas, this is the way they have to be.#$e#My mother had me out feeding the cows before I was even a teenager.
